creator: uber.third@gmail.com
text:
Hi,
 I have Server version: Apache/2.2.3 running on 
Linux 2.6.18-53.1.13.el5xen #1 SMP Mon Feb 11 13:41:50 EST 2008 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux machine. It has mod_deflate.c module of 2.2.17 version. Apache server is reverse-proxing the request which is served by another tomcat server. All the business logic is running in tomcat server(separate machine). Apache2 is inflating, running bunch of regex replacement and deflating it back.

 This machine is under high load. I see that our 0.6% of response are severed as machine code to browser(shown below). Under low load on separate server we don't see this issue. To me it looks like that it's server two sets of HTTP headers. Is this issue fixed in later version of Apache release like 2.2.17. Does upgrade helps here.

creator: jorton@redhat.com
text: Unless you have reproduced this problem using unmodified 2.2.17 sources please report it to your distribution vendor rather than here.
